title: Elon Musk fires a top Twitter engineer over his declining view count

last_post.content:
NEW: Elon Musk fired a top engineer over his declining view counts.

Plus the reason the site went down yesterday, fears about an upcoming FTC audit, and more, and more.

https://www.platformer.news/p/elon-musk-fires-a-top-twitter-engineer

From @zoeschiffer and me.

Think this is a good intelligent-but-not-terribly-knowledgeable-about-ML-tech explainer of ChapGPT: https://www.newyorker.com/tech/annals-of-technology/chatgpt-is-a-blurry-jpeg-of-the-web

A good example is that I asked ChatGPT about the process of applying for an electricity connection at the City of Cape Town. It gave some sensible sounding steps - download forms, fill in forms, then submit on website.

Except you can't submit the forms via the web, for *reasons*

This is technically a bit of a spoiler for the book, but a) a lot of them are not in the book, and b) the book comes out in half a year, and we’ll all forget by then!

Let’s start!

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mwichary/shift-happens

It’s also a really good word to describe a lot of things in real life too…

Code with swearing is better code.

Jan Strehmel: We find that open source code containing swearwords exhibit significantly better code quality than those not containing swearwords under several statistical tests. We hypothesise that the use of...
https://jwz.org/b/yj95

Ok so. In light of much talking about Bing, Bard and "truth", I looked at what the "Stochastic 🦜" paper warned. The first 2 things, "automatically write term papers" and "interact on social media" have already come true. So....now do we just wait for the third to happen?

title: I had ChatGPT write a Decemberists song

last_post.content:
Colin Meloy of the Decemberists asked #ChatGPT to write a song that Colin Meloy of the Decemberists might have written.

Meloy: "For the record, this is a remarkably mediocre song. I wouldn’t say it’s a terrible song, though it really flirts with terribleness… I want to say that ChatGPT lacks intuition. That’s one thing an AI can’t have, intuition.”

Anyway, Meloy has more intuition about what AI can and can’t do than 90% of the internet

https://colinmeloy.substack.com/p/i-had-chatgpt-write-a-decemberists

Seniors/Families - Low Income - Help With Utilities Bills

Energy (Northern CA)
PGE offers a 20% discount on gas and electricity bills if you have low income - for a single person that is $36,000 or less
https://www.pge.com/en_US/residential/save-energy-money/help-paying-your-bill/longer-term-assistance/care/care.page?

There is also a Family Electric Rate Assistance Program (FERA). A monthly discount of 10% on electricity only

Other utility providers in CA - and possibly other states may offer similar programs

1/n

Internet/Mobile Phone - ALL STATES
The federal government gives low income seniors and families a $30 discount on their Internet. Income requirements
• 1 person: $27,180/year
• 3 people: $46,060/year

Each internet provider has their own signup page (Verizon, Comcast etc)
https://www.xfinity.com/learn/internet-service/acp

If you know of a senior who needs help, please consider helping them fill out the forms online because they may be harder for them

title: Fanfiction Fanzine Collection : Free Texts : Free Download, Borrow and Streaming : Internet Archive

last_post.content:
3rd #fanzine project we provide scans to is the #InternetArchive Fanfiction Fanzine Collection

Also done with publisher permission. In fact some publishers have had these zines up on their websites for a decade (or longer) and we're helping them move to the Internet Archive as they wind down their websites

https://archive.org/details/fanzines-collection

4/n

2nd #fanzine #preservation
#project - we provide scans to
Texas A&M University digital fanzine archive.

This was named after my friend Sandy Hereld and launched in 2013. It is a closed archive, meaning you have to be onsite to see the scans or #TAMU faculty or staff. Publishers have given permission for some of the scans to be available publicly online. Contributors to the zines can always opt out.

https://oaktrust.library.tamu.edu/handle/1969.1/149935

and

https://fanlore.org/wiki/Sandy_Hereld_Memorial_Digitized_Media_Fanzine_Collection

3/n

Someone researched Mastodon archive viewing tools. https://mastodon.lol/@laurenzannah/109841330070058291

My results:

#1 requires more skills than I have

#2 is easy to use but has limits - it opens your newsfeed in the browser on their server, gives basic stats (who is the person you boosted the most? Liked the most?).

Nothing displayed until you enter a specific search term. Ex: fanzine.

You get the text, and a link to the post (which will go dead once the instance shuts down)

Image is for tool #2

1/n

As an exercise in minimalism, I stripped my blogging template down to a bare-bones repo, generating a static-site blog with RSS that publishes to github pages (or wherever) using pandoc and svelte-kit. Audience is maybe beginners, people who love pandoc and are thinking of moving on from Jekyll/Hugo, or people just curious to see how a svelte-kit site works. The whole filesystem-based router has been really eye-opening for me, personally. https://bmschmidt.github.io/bare-bones-blog/ https://github.com/bmschmidt/bare-bones-blog

title: DeBamboozling the Social Security Scare Talk

last_post.content:
Really really good debunker of all that scary talk about Social Security going "insolvent" in the 2030s. Long story short, it's not a huge problem and there's an easy fix.

https://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/debamboolzing-the-social-security-scare-talk

title: Journalism is Lossy Compression - Whither news? - Medium

last_post.content:
Solid perspective here from @jeffjarvis. The post is about #ChatGPT, of course, but Jeff does a great job of putting that system in context:

"When we blame an algorithm for exhibiting bias we should start with the realization that it is reflecting our own biases. We must fix both: the data it learns from and the underlying corruption in society’s soul."

https://medium.com/whither-news/journalism-is-lossy-compression-86380f0bdb50
